Reviews.Title: “very central and good owners”
Reviews.Author: Orhanbaba
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a small and has a very central location. The prices are very reasonable compared to other hotels in Venice. The two ladies (owners of the hotels) are very kind and friendly people. They gave us a child bed free of charge (which is almost impossible in Venice). I recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice in Venice”
Reviews.Author: 138robertj
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at Hotel Hesperia for one night in April 2012 after a last-minute change in plans. The hotel is a short walk from the St Lucia train station, and the directions from the hotel's website were easy to follow. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly, and the room was very comfortable. We were given a room with a canal view, which was lovely. The breakfast was quite good, and the staff was kind enough to watch our luggage while we were sightseeing during the day prior to our evening train to Rome. The hotel would be an excellent choice for anyone visiting Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Blanka S
Reviews.Content: Hotel Hesperia is a small family business. A very friendly and easy going personnel is ready to satisfy all your needs. Rooms are very clean decorated in the Venecian style (Murano glass chandelier and mirrors). Delicious breakfast is served with fruits, yogurt and good coffee. You can eat to your satisfaction. The hotel is on the Cannaregio canal close to the railway station, and this hotel is easy to find. To the San Marko piazza take a vaporeto from Ferrovia slow #1 or fast #2 (25 min with a great site-seeing). After walking packed streets in the tourist center, we appreciated the quiet hotel site situated near by local pubs, where we could taste a real Venetian cuisine and talk to the locals. The personal gives you a helpful suggestion where to go. The hotel is next to the historic Jewish ghetto. A gondola ride tour is close by, call Luka cell.3405116063. He is a great chap and give you a good price for a guide and singing on his round tour which leads through the maze of small canals to the main canal and back.(we got 45 min. Ride for 80 Euro ) For great services, romantic rooms and a practical location, we highly recommend this hotel. Suggestion: From San Marco airport take "Alilaguna" boat to "Guglie". The hotel is on the other side of the canal. Just cross the bridge and walk along the canal (5 min). This is a wonderful way to come to Venice. Some people dislike an odor in the hallway. Remember, this is a very old building located in the over thousand years old decaying city. But rooms are odorless, --as Venetian canals. Also, do not expect elevators in the old Venetian building. Pact light.

Reviews.Title: “canal view room what you expect in venice”
Reviews.Author: milkdoctor
Reviews.Content: great hotel, close to train station, breakfast good, staff very helpful and informative. we had a canal view room and the view was what you would expect of venice. the room was updated bathroom updated and clean, slept well, we stayed in a superior room and it was very large. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jahwari133
Reviews.Content: Traveling through many Italian cities, during our first visit to Venice, my family and i stayed in Hotel Hesperiam, which we find it great. The staff are nice and helpful. The hotel location is great and quite area near the small canal.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: danielyeews
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my family in December 2011 for 1 night. Small hotel located close to the train station, but make sure that you consult a good map before trying to find it or you might get lost. Great value for us, and the rooms were of a fair size. Nice views overlooking the canal, although you'd need to close the windows at night or it might be a little noisy. The staff was really helpful in directing us to the various sights and attractions. We also bought our bus tickets from there, which was convenient. Breakfast was good too. Venice on the whole is pretty small, so we were able to walk to all of the main attractions. Would recommend this!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lillian-Melbourne
Reviews.Content: This was my second time in Venice, first time at Hotel Hesperia. Pros: - Great location, very easy to find, 5 minutes from train station S.Lucia closest Vaporetto S Marcuola - Staff were lovely, very friendly and helpful - We got a standard room for 75â‚¬ (for 2 of us) I requested a canal view when booking and the hotel happily obliged, the view was just beautiful from the window, since the canal beside the hotel is smaller it's a lot less noisy than the grand canal - Room was clean, beautifully decorated, with modern facilities. Even though it was freezing outside the warm stayed warm all night - Buffet breakfast was amazing, substantial - croissants, bread, toast, juices, fruit, yoghurt, tea, coffee, cheese, ham etc, kept us going all day! Cons: - WIFI rate in the hotel is outrageously expensive (10â‚¬ an hour) one could argue that you shouldn't be on the internet if you're in a city as beautiful as venice, but sometimes it's useful for looking up last minute things, and for a hotel at this price I would expect free wifi...

Reviews.Title: “Typically Venetian”
Reviews.Author: 5starbudget
Reviews.Content: My family (4) stayed at Hotel Hesperia for 2 nights. The hotel is very well located being approximately 10 minutes from the train station. You are not required to cross any bridges to reach the hotel. It is in a quiet section of Venice overlooking a canal. However only 100 metres away is the â€œmain roadâ€� with a lot of shops & restaurants. This also is the way to the Pont di Rialto that is only 15 minutes walk. The service was excellent with the staff very knowable of the local area. They were more than happy to help you in any way. They also offered us an upgrade to a room with a canal view for a minimal charge. We also had to leave early when departing & they were happy to open the restaurant 30 minutes earlier to provide us breakfast. The breakfast was fairly basic but very fresh. Also as I was learning Italian, I enjoyed the staff tried to teach me a little more & allowed me to attempt to converse in their language even though they spoke very good English. The hotel is typically Venetian. While the hotel is a little dated it is very clean & quite roomy. The reception & restaurant area were quiet big. Also the reception area did have a strange odour that I presume related to the canals. Having said that you did become used to that. The rooms are also very roomy for European standards. The bathroom was a little on the small side but again very clean. Overall a very good hotel for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Exceed expectation”
Reviews.Author: Lau M
Reviews.Content: I took 2 nights's rest in late Dec before X'mas. First, location is so good that we could walk within 10 min from Santa Lucia Station to the hotel. It is a small hotel with view from outside and the inside is larger than expected. Maybe due to the low season, I find the price was realy attractive compared to the warm and efficient service (thank you Martina), excellent buffet breakfast (I was really starved when seeing those food on self-served table!!), and decent internal fitting out (I like blue tiles in bathroom and glass lamp in the middle of room). We were even given choices on upgrading of room or keeping the room with canal view without upgrading. Simple and caring. I always think that it is a kind of price-quality issues on rating on value. With the price less than Euro 50, I rate it as good to excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great, all round hotel”
Reviews.Author: mfisher49
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Hesperia is a great, small hotel outside of the madness of the St Marks area. It's very conveniently located near the train station and Piazzale Roma (the bus from the airport will stop here). Just makes sure you cross the glass bridge! It takes about 20 mins walk to get to the Rialto and another 20 to get to St Marks Sq. The hotel staff were really friendly and readily available to provide local advice. The reception area was rather whiffy but this did not extend to the dining room or the first floor rooms. There were many options for breakfast - cereal, fruit, pastries, rolls, etc, and the coffee was good. The room was cleaned every day and clean towels were also left every day (despite them being folded and left on the bed). The only downside was that the room was very hot at night and leaving the window open meant that it was a little more noisy than we would have liked early morning. All in all a fantastic budget hotel!

Reviews.Title: “friendly staff, good stay”
Reviews.Author: 2airdogs
Reviews.Content: This was a last minute trip & I emailed the hotel about availability, and received a reply within hours. Then also received another with another room option that just became available. Reservations were made quick and easy. Less than a 10 minute walk after getting off bus we arrived at hotel. We wanted a room with a bed, which was not available for the room we booked for the first night (we stayed 3 nights), so they gave us an upgrade for the first night. We were very thankful. Rooms were plain, but clean. Breakfast was fine. Good coffee & juice though. Staff was very helpful and friendly. We had a cool view of the canal and enjoyed the view. We had a great stay thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Simple and good for short stay”
Reviews.Author: HolidayMemories83
Reviews.Content: We were there early November 2011. We were given a room with canal view and the hotel provided us with sufficient basic facilities. It is within walking distance from Venezia S. Lucia train station. and located near the main shopping street where there are plentiful options of F&B and gifts. Staff are very friendly and approachable and we were very appreciative they gave us waterbus tickets (which can be quite costly), even though they are left behind by other travellers. However, the only problem with this hotel is... there is no lift.. thus, is better to travel light if you are planning to stay in this hotel =]

Reviews.Title: “Good choice near the railway station”
Reviews.Author: R_J_I_Trav
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night in early October. Reason was that we were joining a cruise the following day. We arrived from Florence by train after a few days there. Location was perfect for our needs. 5 minute walk from the station with no bridges to cross. The People Mover to connect with the cruise terminal is also next to the station, so hotel was also very convenient for this. Plenty of restaurants in the area as well. This hotel is not close to St.Mark's Square. But I think it is better for that. Less crowds, but still bustling, and lots of restaurants and bars in the area. Plus you can walk to St.Mark's in half an hour, or take the vaporetto. Hotel is reasonably basic, but is fine. Rooms are comfortable, and some have views of the canal. Breakfast is typical continental. I've had better elsewhere, but is perfectly adequate, with coffee, rolls, juice, yogurt, ham and cheese. Hotel doesn't have a lift, and stairs are steep, but the proprietor carried our heavy bag for us. Very helpful on the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding location”
Reviews.Author: Prinks251
Reviews.Content: This is a small 3 star hotel next to a vaporetto stop but 10 mins from the station. Pros: I would stay here again just for the location. Next to the train station, 5-10 mins walk i.e., close to the bus station and close to the main and vaporetto stop (waterways). Next to some good restaurants plus good distance away from the maddening crowd of the rialto. We could also use the laptop near the breakfast for booking onward tickets and checking emails. We could come and leave the hotel at anytime and still be greeted with warm smile. We booked a room where we didnt have to share the bathroom, so it was great. The room we had overlooked the canal and it was amazing in the morning for our first venice trip. Cons: The stairs were a bit creaky and little steep to climb with all luggage. Although, the lady receptionist obliged us by carrying our heavy luggage all the way up to our room. We could have used a bit more variety in the breakfast (but thats just me being fussy) Also, the TV was an old one with only some 3-4 english channels (who sees TV in venice though!!)

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Value in Venice”
Reviews.Author: William N
Reviews.Content: This is an outstanding hotel for the price we paid. Staff is attentive, warm and multilingual. Location is great: you can walk from the train station with your luggage. It is located on the side of a canal and some rooms (ours did) have a view to the canal. The fact that the bathroom may be in the hallway, outside the room is irrelevant for the bathroom is ample, clean and private (not shared). Breakfast is minimal but quality. There is WiFi in the hotel for a fee.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and great value”
Reviews.Author: Sunworshipper049
Reviews.Content: We arrived via train into Venice and this hotel is close to the train station. The staff were very helpful when we arrived. This was the first destination on our Italian holiday and I was amazed by Venice in general. This hotel was clean and rooms were adequate, we had one with a bathroom in our room, not shared. The views from the room were great over the canal. Our only complaint was a noisy guest down the hallway who was using the shared bathroom all night and kept us up. When we mentioned it to the front desk they advised us that the girls had left and thanked us for telling her. All in all a good experience-great location, great breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Peter G
Reviews.Content: Venice was the last port of call on our Italian holiday, and easily the most anticipated one. In common with all our destinations, it had to ideally be within walking distance of a railway station, and the Hesperia was no exception. We got off the Italian Eurostar at Ferrovia, went straight to Tourist Info and got a map (2 Euro). We found that the hotel was about 10 minutes walk (no bridges) from the Station and therefore ideally placed. We received a very warm welcome and were shown up to our room rather than just being handed our key - a nice touch. The room was a good size and cleaned to a high standard. The hotel is literally yards/meters from a canal and an ideal introduction to Venice - turn left at the canal from the front door and you'll be at the Adriatic coast in 10 minutes; turn right and 10 minutes will see you in town: perfect! Breakfast was served in the dining room and there was a good choice, all based on the typical Italian selection. Overall, a very nice stay and we'd definitely stay there again. Info on travelling to the airport: At the time of writing there is no train(!) to Marco Polo Airport, so it's best to take a land-based bus. The bus station is 10 minutes walk - there's a big bridge to get over - from the Railway Station and you can buy tickets in advance. You *must* validate these - the inspectors are everywhere and being a tourist is no excuse: the fine is about 100 Euro!

Reviews.Title: “Everything we had hoped for”
Reviews.Author: Richard441
Reviews.Content: It's difficult to add much to the glowing reviews below, but I could not return home without giving two thumbs up to this cozy and friendly establishment. Location is ideal, as it's a short walk from the train station with no bridges to lug suitcases over. Even the walk from Lucia is lined with choice trattorias and gelatorias. Staff was abundantly helpful and inviting. The room was basic but very clean, and it absolutely met our needs. Breakfast was included and was pretty much basic fare, but it was well tended by staff, and served at a delightful street-side setting that left you lingering carelessly. Back to location.....after two days of fighting tourists and crowds at San Marco and Rialto, we spent the last night strolling the neighborhoods of Cannaregio. Leaving Hesperia, cross the Ponte Guglie and wander down to Strada Nuova. The markets and restaurants are busy but uncrowded, and full of local charm. This was my favorite night in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here whenever I'm in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: sushi3
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very convenient if you are coming to Venice by train with luggage. It is not a long walk and is without any bridges. The common rooms are very nice. Breakfast was very good. They were kind enough to make me an iced cappuccino every morning. We were given a room with a canal view, which was very nice. The only problem I had with the room is that they did not have a dresser with drawers. Only a closet. We spent six nights and had to use our luggage as our drawers. They have a rooftop terrace, which was nice. Also an area outside the hotel where you can eat your breakfast. There is also a small bar which was convenient to get have drink before going to dinner. Bar prices were pretty good too! We purchased a bottle of proscetto for a gondola ride with our friends and the hotel was kind enough to supply me with plastic champagne glasses. Very nice touch! My friends were thrilled. There are plenty of shops and restaurants in the area too. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “charming family run hotel”
Reviews.Author: Catherine R
Reviews.Content: We were very fortunate to have booked Hotel Hesparia for our first trip to Venice. A short walk from the Central Railway station & we were there. The roof top terrace was lovely for drinks at dusk...no- one else staying there used it the whole time we were there! Our view was divine...the little General store right on our doorstep great for supplies... Carolina & Michaela charming & informative hosts.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful small hotel”
Reviews.Author: fancynanc
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights at Hotel Hesperia and could not have been more pleased with the location, cleanliness and extremely warm and helpful staff. We were able to walk to several different Vaparetto stops and that made getting around easy and fun. Its location on a quiet side canal made us feel like we were part of the local life without the noise of other locations. The only negative comments I can make (if I have to) is that I would have liked to have some kind of eggs in the morning as I got tired of cereal and rolls. The other is that there was no dresser drawers to use, but we managed anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: sheilamoreland
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel, Staff very friendly and helpful, location good, close to the main street, but just off it so nice and quiet. Breakfast very good too - loved the soft rolls. Room was clean, bed comfortable, shower facilities good. Can't fault the place or the staff who have better english than my italian. Been there 3 times now, and I'm sure it won't be our last....

Reviews.Title: “Excelent location”
Reviews.Author: SP_Rick
Reviews.Content: If you don't want to carry your bags sÃ³ far, Hesperia is near to the train station. The place is Nice, in front of one Chanel a fÃ©w steps from the .

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and cheap hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: BPerlmutt
Reviews.Content: I loved it! Great hotel with a nice view of rooftops. Staff was super friendly and helpful. Room was private and cozy. Highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely small hotel”
Reviews.Author: diablotin_voyageur
Reviews.Content: The room was very clean and beautiful. The A/C was very efficient, so even with the high exterior temperature, the room was comfortable. Staff very friendly and helpful. Good location: near the train station. I strongly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jirka6
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel with my 2 children. The location of the hotel is excellent. It is in the old town but in the quite area. The room was little bit small but tidy and clean. I liked the home-like breakfast and my children loved the chocolate in the morning. I recommend it to anybody visiting Venezia. The price for stay compared to other hotels in Venezia is nice.

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest experience ever - we will be back”
Reviews.Author: EricVb1111
Reviews.Content: The staff were extremely friendly The hotel is clean, quiet and comfortable. It is also within walking distance from the trainstation and the car park which is very good (no need for vaporetto!) - you can buy ACTV tickets in the hotel and avoid the long queues at the entrance to Venice (tickets I forgot to buy online beforehand)

Reviews.Title: “Great location outside of main tourist area”
Reviews.Author: Nicole B
Reviews.Content: - Good value for the price, according to Venice standards - Located on a lovely canal (we had canal view) - Some issues with hot water, which the reception did not want to discuss, but got us 50% off the room rate for 1 night - No elevator (but that is common for Italy - Breakfast included, but only continental - Great private patio for enjoying a bottle of wine

Reviews.Title: “Our favourite Venice hotel”
Reviews.Author: larsCopenhagen
Reviews.Content: Fourth time we've stayed in this nice and friendly little hotel. We've always met a kind service from the very first booking contact and love the view and feeling of the local (non touristic) life from one of the rooms facing the canal - just a few minutes from the crowded tourist routes.

Reviews.Title: “good location, poor management”
Reviews.Author: Loredana_sv
Reviews.Content: A very bad experience, which made our stay less confortable that it was suposed to be. 5 rooms booked and payed and arrived too early for check in so we all left the luggage at the hotel and mentioned that we will take the rooms we booked in the eveving. The surprise was that one of the rooms was given without a bathroom ( I received a key for a bathroom in the lobby near the washroom for the breackfast room) even if all the rooms was payed with all the facilities. Trying to fix this problem with the management of the hotel I found myself in the position to be told told that " if you don't like you can go to another hotel" and " I can not give you another rooms because I made all the check- ins" Fortunatelly after more then 30 minutes spent on the phone with one of the Hesperia management person and one night spent in a very poor quality room- no bathroom, next day I was given the room that I booked and payed. I waited quite a long time for this review because I wanted to post a fair one, even if I will never go to this hotel and I will never recommended because of the lack of respect from the management and the worse attitude I ever seen in a hotel regarding a complaint of a customer. Otherwise the hotel has a good location, poor breakfast but tipical for Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average in everything else”
Reviews.Author: undome
Reviews.Content: First for the good: Location of the hotel is great, especially if you arrive by train. No need to cross bridges, just a 10 min walk from the station, right next to a canal. There's a vaporetto stop on the other side of the canal, so you get an easy access to the city and the islands too. We mostly walked though, if you are reasonably fit, Venice is not really that big to do on foot. Venice is a horribly expensive city, maybe for a reason. Hesperia in that context is very reasonably priced but is definitely not a budget option. We did receive nice service and everyone was very friendly at the hotel. Now for the negatives. First of all, internet costs. I do think that nowadays internet should be free, especially if the hotel is not cheap. The price was not even very reasonable, 5 EUR for 1 hour. This really irritated us as we needed the connection to book our next accommodations. The room was tiny and we had pretty big suitcases as we had been travelling for 2 months. Also, there was no A/C and it was seriously hot the time we stayed, almost +30 Celsius every day. Furthermore, there is no lift, but we didn't really have issues with carrying things. Breakfast was included, but it was terrible. I have never had such plastic-y rolls. I resorted in eating the packaged crackers rather than the bread. Also, coffee tasted like instant nestle, which is rather despicable as we were in Italy! All in all, would not return. But then again, we are only intending to return to Venice once we have more money to put in it. It's not the place to save I guess.

Reviews.Title: “Helped us in a crunch”
Reviews.Author: TriciaGRowe
Reviews.Content: Hotel Hesperia saved the day! My husband and I arrived in Venice only to find that our bags did not arrive due to a short connection in Atlanta. When we arrived at Hotel Hesperia Carolina and the other staff were SO helpful in calling the airline, checking on our bags for us, telling us where to go to buy new clothes and toiletries. Also, the hot water was broken in the building, so exhausted we decided to stick it out and they knocked off $50 to our bill. They were so helpful to a very stressful, frustrating problem. Venice can be very expensive so Hotel Hesperia was a great choice for a great price. Breakfast was delicious and the location is helpful with travelers rolling bags in the city. You don't have to cross a bride from the train station to get there. Major perk!

Reviews.Title: “Great location - wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: holycook
Reviews.Content: Venice was the highlight of our wonderful 10-day trip to Italy, even though we spent the least amount of time there. It's on the top of our we-must-go-back-there list. When searching for a place to stay for our two nights, the primary criterion was location, to be near the Jewish Ghetto where we would be eating and spending significant weekend time. With so little time in the city, we wanted a hotel that would be very near the train station, our mode of arrival/departure. The hotels our friends/family had recommended were all booked, so we searched on our own. We weren't disappointed. The best part of the hotel, in terms of our needs, was the location. It's an easy 8-10 min walk from the train station and, most important (since we had several pieces of luggage with us), it's a flat walk, with no bridges (read: steps) on the way. It's a family-run hotel (two sisters and staff) and there's always someone on duty at the front desk, 24/7 (the only one of our 3 stays in Italy that we could say that). There's a lobby and lovely breakfast room on the main floor, and the latter even has some tables outside right on the street, a quiet side street (though only one block from a major thoroughfare). The room is small but very adequate, with a modernized bathroom/shower ensuite. The only problem was that because the windows faced a courtyard and other rooms, we had to keep the shutters closed since the curtains were sheer and one could easily see into the other rooms. The TV (and remote) worked, and unlike Florence (where the TV didn't work at all) and Rome (where they had only Italian channels), we were able to catch CNN, which was a good link to the 'outside' world, however briefly we wanted that. The night stands and ceiling had beautiful Venetian glass chandeliers (see photo) which made the room even lovelier and more connected to its unique location. The staff was very helpful regarding sites and getting around and even sold water taxi passes to avoid our having to wait on line at the cashiers near the canals. One thing we'd learned from our first stop in Florence (see that posting) was the importance (and frequent lack) of elevators when arriving with heavy luggage. So I double-checked a few days before arrival, saw they had no elevator (I hadn't particularly looked for that when I made our original reservation) and happily paid a surcharge for a room on the first floor (we would've had to bring our stuff up two flights if we hadn't upgraded - that was a close one!). The closest water taxi stop is a 5-8 min walk away which is a bit less convenient but didn't really matter since we were not traveling on them with luggage and didn't mind the short walk. As noted in my other postings (Rome and Florence), here, too, there was a charge for WIFI access, and it was particularly expensive - charging by the half-hour and not even by the day, so the one shortcoming for techies. One lovely feature we took advantage of one late afternoon was the rooftop terrace. Yes, this did mean walking up 3 flights from the street (but only 2 from our room), we were treated to a small rooftop terrace with table and chairs, a bit of a view (treetops of the nearby public park) and sunlight, birds and flowers. A wonderful break after a busy day of sightseeing before heading out to dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay. Great staff.”
Reviews.Author: levtahor
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean air conditioned room of reasonable size even with baby cot. We had room with view of Cannaregio canal. This was a bit noisy but very enjoyable part of the Venice experience. Location is very convenient to the Jewish Ghetto area and to the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Nice small hotel in venice”
Reviews.Author: gondwanas
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here. The reception staff were all really lovely, helpful and accommodating to specific needs. The hotel is in a nice quiet street right on canal, 5 min walk from train station, and 2min to water bus stop. We had an economy room with private bathroom in hallway, the room is standard size for Venice but this small hotel is exceptionally clean, plus we had a great canal view. We have already recommended it to friends & we will be staying here again when returning to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly, well run hotel”
Reviews.Author: James131038
Reviews.Content: The Hesperia Hotel is ideally situated in the Cannaregio district of Venice, very near the Guglie bridge from where you can catch either water taxi or vaperetto to any part of the city. There are many restaurants and bars in the area and it is an easy walk to the main bus terminal at Piazzala Roma. The hotel is well run by the Derai sisters who are very friendly and helpful with advice and suggestions on how best to explore Venice. A very pleasant breakfast is served either inside the hotel or on tables placed on the pavement outside.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: gskl8
Reviews.Content: close proximity to the venezia train station. The staff are well versed in english and are helpful. Good facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Met expectations of a two star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Love2Travel004
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Room 108 for two nights at the beginning of June 2011. We had a great view of the side canal. The room was a good size and had an adequate bathroom. The fixtures are showing their age (older bath, furniture in room was nicked/ scraped). The room did have a flat panel TV and A/C unit. You have to ask for a staff member to turn on the A/C and adjust the temp for you. No elevator. We had to haul the bags up/down a healthy flight of stairs. The woman who checked us in was very friendly and helpful with guidance for us to get to the airport on our last day in Italy. Hotel location is ok, a 20 min. walk to Rialto bridge and 30 min. walk to San Marco. However, it is about a 10 min. walk from the train station with no bridges to cross, so that was very convenient for us hauling our luggage. Vaparetto was on strike our first day there. Good restaurants in the area (Trattoria Giglio) and plenty of shopping. Breakfast wasn't great as the options are limited (cereal, cookies, fruit, croissant, rolls) and no eggs were available. Interesting quirk here is that you have to leave your key at the desk when you depart, and they give it back to you when you return. Comparing Hesperia to the other hotels we visited this is definitely a 2-star. I think it was expensive for what we got, but we had a hard time finding something closer to San Marco that had availability since we booked about 4 weeks in advance. Check out Bacaro Jazz Bar, near Rialto - good times!

Reviews.Title: “Away from the noisy tourist areas!”
Reviews.Author: KDHSc
Reviews.Content: Although previous reviews stated the canal was noisy, we found it not to be the case when the windows were closed. Continental breakfast was good with great coffee. The only thing I'd recommend is extra pillows as I found most places in Italy in general had relatively "flat" pillows, but that's not specific to only this hotel. Great hostess's who speak fluently in 5 languages. Simply amazing! We stayed on the 2nd floor and our room faced the canal which we really liked. The train station was about a 10-15 minute walk and the bus station was just past that to get to the airport. Take Bus 5 to the airport. Make sure to buy the ticket for the water taxi (Vaparetto's) at the hotel and you'll get to see the entire main canal. One of them even goes to Murano, which I highly recommend a 1/2 day visit to see. We felt very say in Venice even at night so feel free to get lost. Remember you're on an island and you can only go so far!

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Stay - Would Return”
Reviews.Author: kdlaws
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent two nights here in mid May and were thoroughly pleased with our stay. This was our first time in Italy and Venice was our first stop, so I had my trepidations about how much trouble we might have making our way from the airport to the hotel. But, with a little TA research and excellent directions from the hotel website, we made our way without issue via the Alilaguna; the hotel was a quick 3 minute walk from the stop (over one bridge, with ramps). When we left Venice it was by train, and the train station is a convenient 5 minute walk from the hotel (no bridges). We really appreciated that the front desk is staffed 24/7, and that all the staff that we encountered were quite friendly and spoke very good English. The room was a bit small (hey, it's Europe!) but very nice - tastefully decorated and clean. There was some street noise at night but we were so exhausted from our explorations that this didn't bother us much. We paid a bit more for the room than I usually prefer to spend (EUR 330 for 2 nights), but, I understand that May is the start of peak season, Venice is notoriously expensive, and we booked only a couple of weeks before arrival. Breakfast was adequate (more so than others we experienced in Italy) and included ham, cheese, bread basket, fruit, yogurt, juice, coffee. Free Wifi (15 minutes per night stayed, can be used all at once or off and on) was also appreciated. If we were to return to Venice, we'd likely stay here again, and would recommend it to friends and family as well.

Reviews.Title: “Second Visit - As great as the first!”
Reviews.Author: Cherie3743
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to Hotel Hesperia and it was just as good as last time! I had the room right at the top of the hotel which was again spotlessly clean and charming with a great balcony from which I watched the comings and goings on the canal! The rooms are not luxurious but very nicely decorated and very clean! The family who run this hotel are gorgeous - the kind of people who SHOULD be running a hotel!! My requests from Australia were promply answered and I was made to feel very welcome. The hotel is located in a great central area - and very easy to get to from the Airport - I was given easy to understand instructions - easy peasy and no stress! Whilst very close to everything (included the train station) it is just a few streets (or canals!) away from the busy tourist area - a matter of a few minutes only but it makes all the difference! Breakfast is the usual continental fare, but plenty of it and nice coffee!! I will definitely stay there next time I go (when the credit card has recovered!)

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced, friendly and helpful hosts, position perfect in a quiet area and yet so close to all facilities.”
Reviews.Author: brusada
Reviews.Content: For those looking for a quiet reasonably priced hotel and yet so close to all the things one must see whilst in Venice this small hotel is perfect. The hotel staff are friendly and helpful and will provide all the information necessary. Breakfast is in a small room downstairs or outside depending on the weather. All in all a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great family run small hotel”
Reviews.Author: MickyT200
Reviews.Content: Our stay couldn't have started better when Gianni asked us to take a seat outside whilst, after checking us in, he returned with a glass of prosecco each becuase he had noticed from my passport that it was my birthday - a nice gesture. The hotel is small, no bar or lounge area to speak of, the roof top terrace isn't up to much but the service and friendliness of the staff was excellent. The continental style buffet breakfast was an excellent way to start the day. The rooms were very clean and tidy with daily towel changes. If you want a canal view you need to be in 105, 106 or 107 or 205, 206 or 207. We were in 209 which is a strange arrangement as to access this room you exit the building on the 2nd floor as if to visit the roof terrace and the room is separate is kind of detached from the main building. That said, it was a great room that almost felt like its own separate apartment, we really liked it. There can be some street and canal noise but nothing you couldn't shut out by closing windows. The hotel location is great, just far enough away from the main drag as not to be too busy and noisy but close enough to walk to everything you would want to visit. Do walk to everything because you see so much en-route and you'll save some money on Vaperetto fares. Don't be afraid to wander off the beaten track as there is very often a pleasant surprise, a nice square or delightful cafe or bar or cheaper restaurant just around every corner. Our favourite island was Burano with brightly coloured houses lining the canals, then Murano for the glass and least favourite Torcello with nothing much to see or do there. For a very worthwhile day trip and a change from Venice take the train to Verona at Euros 6.25 per person each way. Use the self service machine to buy your ticket - dead easy and in English. Will definitely visit Venice again and would have no hesitation going back to the Hesperia.

Reviews.Title: “Good clean hotel with good facilities and breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: joe_sl0e
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Venice only 1 night and this hotel was perfect: reasonable price, good breakfast (especially the coffee), clean room and bathroom, 5-10 mins walk from the station, canal-front location in a quiet spot, helpful owners and a vaporetto stop outside the door. Very nice!

Reviews.Title: “No bridges!”
Reviews.Author: Kirkcaldy
Reviews.Content: Located in a quiet side canal this hotel offers everything you need at a very reasonable price. Only a 8 minute walk from the train station (with no bridges to cross) and with a ferry stop opposite the location is ideal for getting around. The staff are very helpful and speak excellent English.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: MarilynPortland
Reviews.Content: Nice economy hotel. Clean. Easy walk from the train station on the first canal to the north. English speaking staff. Sedate. Enjoyable rooftop terrace. More than adequate. Nice breakfast in a light, enjoyable ground floor breakfast room.

Reviews.Title: “Good traditional hotel, close to everything”
Reviews.Author: Elchinec
Reviews.Content: Very nice staff, especially in the lounge, helped me with preparing a breakfast to the room for my girlfriend. Location is good, even if the city is very small, the hotel is really close to everything and very cosy. Price are of course expensive, it cost us 150 euros for two nights for a room with canal view, but this is Venice and you don't spend there too much time and two days are enough and surely it is worth this money. Only minus was, that we could hear people talking in neighboring room, but that did not spoil anything as we were very tired after walking the whole day and fell asleep immediately) P.S. One advice, don't eat in restaurants near famous places and where staff calls you in. There are plenty of cheaper restaurants with much delicious food. One of them is near the hotel, turn left and go straight, pas the small bridge, it is very small and always full, so book in advance, food is perfect. There is also an Il Million restaurant, google it, a very nice place and very nice veal there.

Reviews.Title: “Convienient & easy walk from train termini & Very Charming”
Reviews.Author: eddy34101
Reviews.Content: We were happy with location and hotel. Got a nice room with view of canal : separate bathroom down hall but private for us only. Clean , charming & very convenient location. Quieter , at night but get ready for noise anywhere, as Venezians stay up late and it's a small city so you do hear noise .. but it quiets down as it gets very late. No breakfast included (unless you pay ) No free internet but they have internet you can pay for. Nice staff: Clean Hotel. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for a Venetian getaway”
Reviews.Author: RJB11
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel near Santa Lucia train station. Rooms were spotless, more than comfortable and good value for money. We were lucky to have a beautiful view of the canal. It is run by a friendly local family that speak perfect English and know the city extremely well. Breakfast was exceptional. Juice, Cereals, yoghurt, fresh fruit, croissants, bread, cheese, ham and more. Make sure you ask them to recommend you a local restaurant. We had a great night at Alla Botte. Ideal for couples and business travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, very clean - perfect for a sightseeing weekend!”
Reviews.Author: KSE9
Reviews.Content: We had an absolutely wonderful weekend stay at this charming hotel. The staff were all very friendly (lending me an adaptor plug when I realised I'd forgotten mine) and spoke excellent English. The buffet breakfast was perfect (croissants, bread, jams, ham, cheese, cereal, fruit juices, coffee, hot chocolate) and the whole hotel was spotlessly clean. The location was good - near the railway station and lots of reasonable restaurants, but quite a walk from the Rialto bridge / San Marco etc. I would wholeheartedly recommend this hotel to anybody going for a sightseeing weekend in Venice on a budget - also, if you book in advance then you can get some fantastic prices.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay near the grand canal...”
Reviews.Author: Jaggu007
Reviews.Content: Great staff and a nice place to stay during the holidays

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, friendly, affordable, comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: Catharine_Alexander
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very close to the railway station in a quiet calle in view of the canal. You can walk to St Mark's in about 15 or 20 minutes and all the vaporetto routes pass close by. The family who run the hotel are pleasant, friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. My room was warm (it was minus 2 outside!), comfortable and clean. It was a little noisy though, but this was due to the age of the building I think. In other hotels single rooms are often inconvenient and run down but in this case the room was fine. I thought the hotel was very reasonably priced given its location. Breakfast was ample and tasty and is included in the price.

Reviews.Title: “We would definitely stay here again: great value, great location, great room.”
Reviews.Author: mikerosella
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through its website for 4 nights the first week of November, paying the low but non-refundable rate for a mid-level room (king bed, full private bath). Booking was easy, and email confirmation was instant. After landing at Venice airport, we opted for the lagoon "bus" service, buying our tickets at a booth in the airport, then walking outside and around to the back, where there is a dock. Got on the boat, then rode across the lagoon to the Fondemente Nuove landing, from where we walked across the Cannaregio sestiere to the Ponte Guglie, then up the Cannaregio Canal a block to the hotel. A great way to enter the city and get our legs back under us after the long overnight flight to Italy! We were greeted warmly and offered two rooms, including an upgrade to a larger room on the third floor (note: no elevator) overlooking the canal, for only an additional 10 Euros per night. We took it, and were delighted. Every day we were able to look out our windows and watch a real working canal - vaporettos (local waterbus service), taxis, ambulances, police, freight, commerce. Strangely, it was never noisy. The room not only had the king-size bed but also a desk and a daybed, yet was large enough to move around comfortably. There were also two bedside tables with reading lamps - perfect for us. There was a nice closet, with a small refrigerator and a safe. The bathroom had a large shower and was kept spic and span. Breakfast - which was included with the room - was served buffet-style in a pleasant dining area on the ground floor. Lots of good choices, including fruit and cereals, yogourt and croissants, and great coffee served at your table. For 82 Euros per night, there is no question this was a great bargain for such a gem of a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Aweful room”
Reviews.Author: SR786
Reviews.Content: The room was aweful for its price. During our italy trip, this was the worst room which we had and the room didnt have even a television. And the staff was not ready to change our room even though they had other vacant rooms. Bathroom was too congested to even have a shower properly.

Reviews.Title: “straightforward friendly hotel well located for transport”
Reviews.Author: scarlettillidie
Reviews.Content: wasn't looking for anything special on this trip but pleasant location, very easy access to ferry from airport and just few minutes walk from train/bus station, on the canal , and easy stroll into san polo/san marco - room clean and serviceable , perfectly warm even with sub zero outside , friendly helpful staff and easy atmosphere . Breakfast adequate - perhaps a litle basic but fine. Good reasonable hotel for no frills short stay

Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: snopn
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel with a excelent location. It has a very comfortable room and the cost-benefit is the best.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem”
Reviews.Author: daniela_peloso
Reviews.Content: I previously stayed at this hotel in 2004 and it continues to not disappoint me. The hotel is conveniently located near the train station - not too far - just a 10 minute walk. The hotel is owned by a local Venetian family. The staff, who include family members, are friendly and helpful. The rooms are clean and comfortable and the rooms are very reasonably priced considering the location. There is a vaporetto stop located near the hotel where you can get a vaporetto to the airport. I'll definitely be staying at this hotel again on my next visit to Venice. Daniela, Sydney

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, well located and as good as anticipated”
Reviews.Author: Mathieu1962
Reviews.Content: This hotel is walking distance from the Railway station (close but not to close at the same time - 5-7 minutes walk). This area of Venise is my favorite one - not as touristic as many others (ie Place St-Marco, Rialto area, Academia ...). Friendly and professional welcome at the hotel, clean and well decorated room. This how 2 stars should all be ! Internet is fast and not too expensive (5 euros for one hour - it would be free it would obvioulsy be better). This is a place I recommend - ( it was my 3rd stay in visit). Breakfast is good (with fresh fruits and cappucino coffee like it should be). Charming 400 years + building ... Enjoy your stay ! Mathieu from Canada

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, great hospitality”
Reviews.Author: beijefam
Reviews.Content: We, my wife Matty and I, Jan, had a good stay in Venice. Our stay in Venice started with a lot of rain and coldness but after one day: sunshine and higher temperatures. The days started and ended in our lovely hotel Hesperia. The people of the hotel were very friendly and helped us to find our way in Venice. When ever we will come back, we will remember the name of Hesperia. Thanks Venice, thanks Hesperia

Reviews.Title: “Great find”
Reviews.Author: k_and_g_from_seattle
Reviews.Content: We were told about this hotel from friends of ours. It was perfect- small, charming, close to the train station, but slightly off a main thorough-fare. The manager was exceptionally helpful regarding restaurant recommendations and finding a hotel for us for the next night (as alas they were booked for the second night). Great find/great value.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: babyboomer58sydney
Reviews.Content: Very handy to the Railway Station only 10 minutes walk. Basic accommodation but comfortable and staff including Martina very helpful. Breakfast was delicious. Our room overlooked the Canal and only a 1/2 hour walk to St. Marks Square.

Reviews.Title: “Love the location”
Reviews.Author: prcmeiguoren
Reviews.Content: There have been mixed reviews on the location and I guess it comes down to what one wants in a location. For us, the hotel location was absolutely perfect. Close to the water bus stop, about 15 minutes to train station and easy walking to all the other sites if prefer to walk. Many eating choices with 5-10 minutes. Yet, it is in a quiet location. The outside could definitely using some sprucing up, be we were happy with our 1st floor room overlooking the canal. 108, with an ensuite bathroom. As others mention, tv is small and the only night we cared was when Milan was playing and we left the restaurant down the canal to come back and watch the rest of the game. Unfortunately it wasn't even on the few channels available. Staff was friendly, courtesy and helpful with recommendations on places to eat. We would definitely stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fishmael2
Reviews.Content: A fine hotel in Venice. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful, and the room was quite comfortable. While it is a little far from the main points of interest, it is very close to the train station and a vaporetto stop, which makes getting around pretty easy.

Reviews.Title: “Warm, friendly family run Hotel,perfectly positioned to discover Venice!”
Reviews.Author: sallycumming
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly suprised with the accomodation. Our room was comfy with lots of room to move. Our bathroom was large and very clean and even though it was just outside our room it was solely ours while we stayed there. The large shuttered window looked directly onto a smaller canal which the "Venice " experience perfect. Loved waking up to the canal sounds of a morning. A easy 15min walk and we were at San Marco Square, in which the friendly staff are happy to draw on a map along with any other directions and help you need. The station is 10 min walk away. The biggest bonus was a fantastic breakfast which is included in the price. Thanks Hotel Hesperia .

Reviews.Title: “Vacation in Venizia”
Reviews.Author: LuckyTravel4_2_24
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Hesperia was a wonderful, quiet respite from the the throngs of shops and tourist activities found throughout Venice. It is an easy stroll from the train station with the added benefit of no bridges to cross with heavy luggage. The family atmosphere is very inviting and the staff will do their best to answer every question. They even insisted on helping to carry our bags to the second floor! Room furnishings are not new but quite comfortable, with spacious rooms a bonus for Venice. Breakfast is in the traditional European style including meats and cheeses with the option of eating inside or outside. All sights and shopping are easily accessible on foot within 30 minutes, or a vaporetto stop is directly across the canal.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable service and a great find!”
Reviews.Author: jonquille604
Reviews.Content: We had a fabulous stay here. We had to book at the very last minute and during the film festival to since there was an administrative error made by the hotel we were originally going to stay at. Martina could not have been more helpful. She ensured that we had the best available room and handled all our inquiries and requests with ease and efficiency. We got a private, third floor room with a canal view and shared terrace area. This was probably the quietest accommodation we had in all of Italy. Breakfast was such a pleasant surprise. After days of nothing but croissants and coffee for breakfast, we had a full-on yogurt-fruit-toast-cereal affair and we could not have been more pleased. We're so lucky to have found this quiet gem away from the tourist hordes and could not recommend this more highly.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: DANDO2010
Reviews.Content: Hotel Hesperias location is the best thing about the hotel. It is in a nice quiet part of town but still super close to everything. There are great restaurants a couple of doors down and there is a ferry stop that will take you almost anywhere just across the canal. The Staff are very friendly and helpful. The hotel itself has seen better days. It is a a bit tired and rundown outside and in but the rooms are reasonably clean. It is very basic, the only luxuries the rooms have are a very small TV (with only Italian TV) and a small fridge. We were stuck in the roof top "out house" which was a bit uncomfortable thanks to the low ceiling and the air con being stuck on low. We also had to put up with other guests using the roof top terrace which meant no privacy and a bit of noise and smoke annoyance. Breakfast is very basic. The cereals are budget brand, the milk is particularly bad long life, the bread rolls were stale and the croissants average. The coffee and fresh Rock Melon are fantastic though and it is nice to sit outside in view of the canal. If it wasn't for the great location I wouldn't recommend staying here because it is overpriced for what it is. If you go in the off season however it would be excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay in a hotel with extremely warm and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: miekeHageman
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a beautiful part of the city. Far enough away from the San Marco area for it not to be too expensive and close enough for an easy walk there. We found the staff very helpful and kind. The breakfast was lovely but could have done with a bit more variety. Having said that, we didn't lack anything. The memory of opening the shutters and having a glorious view of the hustle and bustle of Venetian life on and along the canal will remain with us for a very long time. Grateful couple from Holland.

Reviews.Title: “A nice quiet hotel in a chaotic Venice”
Reviews.Author: ochun5
Reviews.Content: My husband and I found this a wonderful find in Venice, especially in the chaos of a Venetian summer. So centrally located within easy walking distant to the train station, and no bridges and stairs to cross was such a bonus with heavy luggage. The room was extremely spacious and facing the canal - what a joy to wake in the morning, open the windows and shutters and watch the passing traffic on the canal! As a coffee lover my only suggestion for improvement would be to improve the quality of the coffees being served...they were terrible!

Reviews.Title: “nice, but not much more - but the wi-fi is not free!”
Reviews.Author: shlomog
Reviews.Content: the hotel has a good location - close to the train station, and to the vaporato stops. the room is fine, not too old, bot not new. there is a/c and a mini bar, but the wi-fi is not free and quite expensive

Reviews.Title: “Just what we wanted in expensive venice”
Reviews.Author: Kiteflyer216
Reviews.Content: We used Tripadvisor to find this hotel, 2 weeks prior to our stay. On arrival we had the choice of a room overlooking the canal but with a separate (but private) bathroom or a suite but with no aircon. We chose the room witha view, it was clean, comfortable, the bathroom was nice and the staff were extremely helpful in providing tips on restaurants and sights, whilst answering any questions we had. The location is very good (close to the train station, overlooking a nice canal and 1 minute walk from the Grand Canal) as the hotel is close to several water bus stops. To walk to the Piazza San Marco takes 30-45 mins at a nice stroll. Don't forget to enjoy a glass of wine on the hotel's terrace on the top floor! I can recommend this hotel as we had no problems with this and the price was very good. Stay here! Couple of Venice Tips 1. Check the price of drinks before you buy, they can be very high! 2. Takeaway prices vs eat/drink in may be significantly different but usually displayed somewhere in the cafe.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, comfortable place to stay; covenient but removed from throngs of tourists.”
Reviews.Author: SFrederick_10
Reviews.Content: On our second trip to Venice, we returned to Hesperia, which is reasonably priced, quaint, immaculately clean, and comfortable. The owners, Martina and Carolina, are helpful and conscientiously attentive to to the needs of their guests. Hesperia has the advantage, also, of being proximate to the train station but away from the crowds of noisy tourists. It is located on a canal but a much quieter one than the primary waterways. We have recommmended it to family and wil certainly stay there again should we be fortunate enough to return to Venezia.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Clean Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Becliv
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great place to stay if on a tighter budget in the more expensive area of Venice. My Fiancee and I stayed in a room with a canal view, which was an amazing way to experience the city. Only a walk away from the major attractions, major shopping strips and local cafes and restaurants, this hotel was ideally located. Although you don't get all the extras of a pricier hotel, this hotel was clean, very friendly staff, cosey room and a short walk from the railway and parking stations. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is perfect for Venice!”
Reviews.Author: Rhopkins4734
Reviews.Content: Hotel Hesperia is staffed by people who know Venice and are very happy to help you find your way around. The rooms are very clean, small but not cramped, and air conditioned which was really nice in July. The bathroom was spotless and all a traveler needs. The breakfast was delicious and plentiful - just right before a day of walking. The price is a bargain. I would stay here again. It is well located but can be noisy in the morning because the local restaurants are offloading the days supplies early in the morning before it gets too hot.

Reviews.Title: “A charming hotel with friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Vicenza50
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a very good location - close enough to many restaurants & shops but tucked away to give peace & quiet. Very clean rooms, great coffee & tasty breakfast, handy roof terrace. Easy to get to from Piazzale Romana & the station. Very interesting area with charming back streets, lovely bridges & away from the tourist trail. Well worth exploring to see the real Venice. Very good value with personal service - an authentic family oriented hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful find!! Fabulous hosts and lovely hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Cherie3743
Reviews.Content: I booked this based on what I read on Trip Advisor. I was a first time traveller and travelling alone - so a bit nervous! I had no need to worry. It was SUPER easy getting from the Airport to the Hotel - the hosts gave me perfect info before I got there. Even with my luggage it was easy and what a lovely welcome awaited me. The hosts were so kind! They gave me great suggestions on where to eat, visit and the best way to get there!! Room was pleasant and comfortable. Nice and clean I would stay there again in a heartbeat! Good value for money. I booked directly with the Hotel and had A1 service all the way.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Ray0119
Reviews.Content: This is a good choice if you like to live near the train station. Convenient location for shopping and for food.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: ovt11
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel, with very convenient rooms, with a good location and polite staff.

Reviews.Title: “Easy to get to- close to train station, Great service and great deal”
Reviews.Author: Bologna2010
Reviews.Content: Hotel is just a short walk from the Venezia - Santa Lucia train station which is why we chose it. The receptionists speak English really well and can easily help you to get where you need to get. They even tried to help us find a more direct train route. It's a bit of a walk from San Marco and the main attractions but we enjoyed that because it was less crowded, less noisy, and food/shops were a little cheaper. But it was a beautiful area with a less crowded feel. We walked everywhere but the water taxi is really close and you could get to the other side of island easily if you chose to. This is a great value compared with other hotels on the island. The price is still high but cheaper than the other hotels. The value is in the convenience of location on the islands and near the train station, less-crowded area, and great hospitality. We really enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good deal and good location.”
Reviews.Author: Moscow_IDJla
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it was close to the train station and was in a quiet area of Venice. We got a nice clean comfortable room with a view of the closest canal out our window, plus it had air conditioning. The hotel staff were very helpful with helping us get oriented in Venice and figure out the water taxi (vaporetto) system. They also accept credit cards. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for an affordable, clean, comfortable, quiet room in a good location. We enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Hesperia, comfort in a great location”
Reviews.Author: gillieppb
Reviews.Content: Our first stay at this hotel in Venice. We would certainly stay again. Very comfortable with agreeable and helpful staff. Located on Cannaregio Canal across from the Guglie vaporetto stop and a 10 minute walk from the train station. Continental breakfast included.

Reviews.Title: “Spot On away from the crowds”
Reviews.Author: Franklinross
Reviews.Content: If you want a very good quiet 2 Star Hotel close to the main train station and Vapperetto (water taxi) station then this is the one! From the Train Station, easy to find, no Bridges to drag your suitcases over and will take you about 10 â€“ 12 mins to find depending on how many tourists get in your way. (there is a short cut via a back street to avoid the chaos but best to find this once you find the Hotel and settle in) Also the Vapperatto station acts as an Airport Vapperetto (line A) station as well which is Euro 13pp each way and take about 30mins. Hotel basic, clean and friendly, no Lift! Breakfast basic. Tip, Vapperetto ticket one way per person is Euro 6.50! 12 hour pass Euro 16pp, 24 hour 18pp, save queuing in the heat and buy these from the reception and grab a map from them a free map as these can coat you up to Euro 5 each at the information booths. Tip there is a nice little peaceful terrace on the top floor for guests to use, grab a pizza and a bottle of wine!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant and convenient stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: rdy2travel54
Reviews.Content: Only 10 minutes walk from the train station, Hotel Hesperia provided a convenient location from which to explore Venice -- considering one has to carry everything there and back! There is also a taxi stop a 2 minute walk across the canal. Breakfast was more than adequate by European standards: fruit, meat, cheese, yogurt and good coffee. We were upgraded to a small apartment with a refrigerator and small stove which was very quiet and clean. Hotel staff was very helpful and recommended a great nearby family-owned restaurant. If ever go back to Venice, would likely say again.

Reviews.Title: “Off the beaten track but wonderful nonetheless”
Reviews.Author: annepellicci
Reviews.Content: Hotel Hesperia offered all that was missing from our last trip to Venice 12 years ago - spacious comfortable room with own bathroom, quiet location, substantial continental breakfast and most of all, friendly and helpful staff. Carolina spoke near perfect English and was extremely helpful with everything we required. Our only regret was that our stay was so short.

Reviews.Title: “Better than 2-star rating”
Reviews.Author: rjvanden
Reviews.Content: This hotel is rated a 2-star hotel, but we found it had better amenities and service than that. Maybe not quite like the 4-star we stayed at in Milan, but it was quite good. We had a room that was 2-stories, overlooking the canal, and the new windows kept most of the outside noise completely out of the room. The room was quite big, though I don't know what the rest of them look like because, again, we had what I think was a unique 2-level room. But all the normal amenities were there, bathroom, hair dryer, safe, etc. Location is great, one of the hidden treasures for us in Venice was walking to the west side of the city to watch the sun set with the mountains off in the distance, and you're just about right there. Plus, you won't have to deal with lugging that luggage far if you stay here. No issues leaving bags after checkout, as well, since we wanted to hang out in Venice for the day before taking the train out. Hotel Hesperia worked very well for us! Not sure if there was wireless internet, we didn't try in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “So much better than we could have hoped for”
Reviews.Author: ClairkeithTeddy
Reviews.Content: When all the planes stopped flying we took refuge in Venice for a few days (worse hardships have been faced). Booking on the run via Expedia, our aim was to find the cheapest hotel possible near the train station and within walking distance of the ferry port. Anything else was a bonus. The hotel was busy with people extending stays, altering stays or cancelling stays but the staff were cheerful and welcoming, looking after our bags for the morning and letting us check in at 1pm. We were given a fantastic room with a high ceiling and large shuttered window overlooking the canal (we hadn't expected this at all) and with a private bathroom down the hall. The hotel is in a residential area of Venice, relaxed and not overcrowded. The hotel is right by Crea ACTV stop but we walked everywhere. Staff spoke several languages and were absolutely brilliant throughout our stay; helpful, friendly, accommodating and very upbeat. Brightly coloured glass light fittings and chandeliers abound. There is reasonably priced internet access at a communal PC in the lounge and a small outdoor terrace area on the side street. Breakfast was a respectable continental buffet with good freshly made coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly crew, a clean room and excellent breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: dgb11
Reviews.Content: The main purpose of our trip to Venice was a congress that my colleague and I were attending. At first we had booked another hotel, located in San Marco district, but as it was 700 euro for only 5 nights, we changed to Hotel Hesperia, where only one room was still available. And we are so happy that we took this decision! Breakfast was much better than we expected (croissants, small breads, toast, orange juice, hot drink as cappuccino and tea, cheese, bacon, fresh cut fruits), our room was clean and not too small (as many rooms of other hotels in Venice tend to) and the crew was so friendly! After the congress, we took a few days off to explore the city and there were even some travel guides available in the hotel, free to loan. There is also a boat stop just around the corner and the central train station is just a few steps away. The only minus point was that at 6h30 AM, there was some noise at the street, because it seems to be a place where merchants pass when supplying the local bars. But I suppose this depends from what side of the building your room is in. And I have to admit that it would not keep me from booking this hotel again! We had a lovely time.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, friendly, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: mike01sydney
Reviews.Content: This hotel was an excellent choice. Situated with a great view of the canal and central to everything, the room was a good size,and scrupulously cared for. Continental breakfast turned out to include fruit, cereal, ham , cheese, yoghurt, rolls and croissants. Reception could book transport and other tickets for you. But, best of all, the staff were so helpful. There's nothing like a family run hotel at its best. I took my ageing mum and she enjoyed it as much as I did. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “We truely enjoyed this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jalandua
Reviews.Content: What a great location...five minutes walk from the station and water taxis. From the moment that we walked through the door you felt that you were more of a friend than a guest! The staff are wonderful offering great advice on what to do, what to see, and the best times of day to accomplish this. My wife and I would have no reservations in recommending this family run hotel to our family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful budget hotel for a beautiful destination”
Reviews.Author: Jemjems-r
Reviews.Content: This hotel was easy to access via the train station on foot, there was no bridges to climb and it was not far to carry a backpack. It has many places to eat around it and is close to many water bus stations on different lines, it is also in short walking distance of the Grand Canal. The hotel is clean and staff friendly and helpful. Room was comfortable, and we had a fantastic view of the water outside our room, which was very romantic. The shower was broken so for my boyfriend and I who are tall it was hard to have a shower and the bathroom was very small but still good. Breakfast was very simple for a buffet but was fine. The only downside was that the internet was expensive to use as you have to pay for your use unlike many other hotels we have stayed in. For people on a budget it may look like an expensive hotel in regards to price but against most other good hotels in Venice it is cheap and for what you get it is quite reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant budget hotel by a large canal”
Reviews.Author: JabberwockyIndia
Reviews.Content: A warm smiling reception greeted us at Hesperia. It is located by a large canal and just across the waterbus stop for number 52 (the one which does not take the scenic route of waterbuses 2, etc) Finding it - the tough part! Best go from the railway station (5 mins walk, known to all shops and restaurants). Directions in Venice are useless as they always include directions like "go over the 2nd bridge on the left" - Venice is filled with bridges and though it is fun to get lost here, not with you pulling your luggage! Do not go from S.Paulo water bus stop (Venice is a zero vehicle city - not even bicycles. So any reference to buses and taxis mean they run on water) It is located in a residential area in the north east part of the city. Less touristy, very quiet. But the road from station is always alive and just 5 mins walk. Rooms are just the right size for 2 people - I stayed in a canal facing room (a real canal with lots of traffic.. Not the tiny ones near San Marco) - clean, has a washbasin inside the room. The big bathroom is outside your room, but private (only you have the key, and its just 3 metres away). Heating is good (important in Winter!). TV is hopeless-the only English channels are BBC and MTV - this unfortunately seems to be the case in most of Venice. The breakfast place is charming with all the signs of a mansion turned into a hotel. Like in most of Italy, there were hardly any items (bread, croissants, cereals, juice, cheese, coldcuts, and the mandatory 5 types of coffee and tea). Why is breakfast in Italy and most of Europe so sparse? All in all, Excellent value for money. About 60 euros per night in off season (Winter) Warning - there is no elevator. Tip - the road from station is has good places to eat with reasonable costs

Reviews.Title: “Great affordable room with rooftop balcony overlooking canal”
Reviews.Author: marcoammannati
Reviews.Content: I am italian myself so I have been to Venice a number of times. We only paid 60GBP for an esquisite room located on the rooftop with massive balcony. Room was clean and lovely. Comfortable bed with clean linen. Nice bathroom, tv, and really lovely people at reception who gave us tips for restaurants too. Strongly recommend though we saw the high season rates climb to a steep 200 euros per night (july august, a time when Venice is best avoided for fould smells and nasty heat). We were there in November and it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Warm welcome in Venice”
Reviews.Author: DutchYank
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 spent two nights in December, 2009. By booking on-line directly with the hotel the bill averaged â‚¬ 65 per room per night (double bed with bath and good breakfast). Very conveniant location. about 15 min walk from the train station. Grocery store on the canalcorner. Restaurants and more shops close by. Only problem was the water heater. It took minutes for hot water to come out of the shower spout. Very friendly staff offering important info about weather, high tide flooding etc. . I'll certainly return next time I visit Venice !

Reviews.Title: “Great value for this price and this location !”
Reviews.Author: 100attitude
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my adult son for 3 nights, closing weekend of Biennale. Cosy family hotel, with small but decent and clean rooms. No noise at night. Perfect coffee at breakfast, which was anyway better then many three star italian hotels. Staff was charming, friendly and helpful. Location is excellent: 5 minutes walk of main train station, but very calm little street, next to a beautiful canal (with vaporetto stop). If you'r lucky, yo'll have a room with a view on the canal. Neighborhood (getto, north Cannaregio) is less affected by tourism then other Venice parts, although still more touristic then almost any other European city of course...). No lift in the hotel. We were upgraded a room (with bathroom en suite) as reward for my internet booking. They know how to please their guests, and they do it with a big smile. For this price one cannot find better I guess.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Great Location”
Reviews.Author: spencer51
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, only a short walk from Santa Lucia Station and right on the canal with a vaporetto ( water taxi ) station nearby. We booked online and noticed after we had confirmed that the room we had booked had a seperate private bathroom a short way down the corridor, however when we arrived we were given the option of having a room with its own ensuite at the same price, which we took. Room was very clean with an air conditioner and a safe for valuables. Bathroom was tiny but adequate. The two sisters who run the place along with their father were all very friendly and helpful. Wireless internet available or you can use the hotel computer but there is a charge. Breakfast was great too. Plenty of restaurants nearby as well as a couple of small supermarkets. Only thing to note is that the hotel does not have an elevator so you will need to carry you luggage up the stairs but overall it was great value ( by Venice standards) and a great location

Reviews.Title: “excellent budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: VenusSolihullUK
Reviews.Content: Well situated , extremely pleasant comfortable hotel at a reasonable price . Room slightly basic but more than adequate for short stay. Unfortunately no canal view from our room. Friendly management and ....generous breakfast. Tip ..try and get a room at front with with canal view.We would certainly stay there again . John And Ros Venus.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location, friendly, excellant value.”
Reviews.Author: ringwaytraveller
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from Venice - the hotel was very clean & comfortable and within easy reach of both the bus & train stations. We enjoyed the more than adequate breakfasts and the owners and staff were very friendly & extremely helpful. The hotel is ideally situated for exploring the city - a valporetto station is across the canal.

Reviews.Title: “What a nice little place to see Venice”
Reviews.Author: TheOODALoop
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spent 2 nights in Venice. We arrived during the heaviest rain Venice had seen in a long time. The father who was on duty, promptly sourced a pair of fernpickers (Norway boots) for my wife to wear in the flooded streets. The hotel was very convenient to the train station and located right on the canal. The room was small, but clean (the bathroom was recently updated) and it was quiet at night. The sisters and father were very accomodating and breakfast was good. For the price, I felt it was a great bargain. My only comment is that Venice is a 1 day/1 night trip. And be prepared for 200.00 for a gondola ride if you are so inclined. Otherwise, save the cash and take the #1 vaporetto down the Grand canal for 7.50 euro.

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL VENICE”
Reviews.Author: Aus-traveller09
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights here, a quaint hotel within easy walking distance to train station, which in my opinion is far superior to hauling luggage on and off boats. We paid a little extra for a room with views of Canneregio canel, well worth the extra. The room was good size, bathroom tiny, air conditioner worked well. The lack of elevator just meant exercising on the stairs. Breakfast is basic. We loved Venice and with a 48hr boat pass found the location no problems, in fact it is relaxing motoring along the canals. There are boat stops both sides of the canal at the hotel door. Staff were very helpful and assist with luggage up and down the stairs.

Reviews.Title: “One night in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Nahna
Reviews.Content: Close to train station, just off the corner of the canal. I could see the canal if I stuck my head out of the window. The room was nice, clean, and the air conditioner worked! Breakfast was included for 90 Euros. No ice!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jcrichton
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Hesperia Hotel for a few days in June - this was our second stay there in 3 years. The hotel is small but the rooms are all clean. It is very convenient for the railway / bus station. The breakfasts were perfectly were the normal continental and perfectly adequate. Staff were all pleasant and helpful. Hotel represents good value and would certainly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A ver nice stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: elector
Reviews.Content: We just spent 3 days at the hotel. We had an excellent time. The hotel rooms are small, but comfortable enough for 3 persons (we rented 2 rooms), the view from our windows was spectacular. The bathroom is small, but very clean. The 2 sisters that run the hotel are very nice and help with all kind of suggestions (great cappuccino).
