The small market next to the hotel is very convenient and affordable (for bottle waters and sodas). We will definitively recommend it

Reviews.Title: “I'm truly shocked this hotel is receiving such good reviews”
Reviews.Author: Casinoroyale72
Reviews.Content: A two star hotel that is exactly that. I arrived June 2nd with a nice check in - the gentleman carried my luggage up 2 flights of stairs, showed me my room and left me with an A/C remote. I don't know what a hostel looks like, but I'd imagine it's the Hotel Hesperia. Bare bones minimum - very old furniture, a stone floor with not a single rug, a 1950's tv ( about 8 inch) hanging from the ceiling with about 7 channels (none English speaking) and a "double" bed that was simply two small twins pushed together. The bed was so hard, I could literally feels the springs jutting into my body and struggled to sleep the 3 nights I was there. The shower and shower curtain are tiny, so if someone is remotely obese, the floor will flood. Anyway, on my first day there I soon discovered that my ATM card wasn't working and had about 5 euro. I went back to the hotel to find a different man at the desk who claimed to be French and spoke no English and little Italian. He flat out refused to let me use the phone and contined eating his dinner at a table behind me while I cried and used the computer (for a fee) to try to work it out. By the way, I'm a 30-something female who was travelling alone. In the morning, the woman at the desk let me use the phone (with a 10 euro charge on the bill) so that worked out. When I came back that night, my A/C was off and the remote was gone. The same guy from the night before came up, turned it on and refused to give me a remote. Couldn't change the temp..it was either on or off. He continued to say "no change room tonight" and was tapping his watch impatiently...but that wasn't what I was asking - I just simply wanted another remote. I'm giving this hotel 2 stars solely based on location (about 10 min walk from train station with several water bus stations nearby) and breakfast, otherwise it would be zero. Terrible room and unaccomodating staff. I should have taken a picture of my room, but it wasn't the pretty ones your seeing on this website. The kicker was, it was 460 euro for 3 nights. I could have done better, and so can you. I will never return.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: papsLondon
Reviews.Content: Fabulous family run hotel in a brilliant area- quiet but within easy walking distance of the main sights of Venice. Warm friendly welcome by the two sisters who run the hotel. Lovely breakfast in a relaxed unhurried manner. Helpful information willingly given to guests about the many sights to be seen in this wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “We'd stay here again”
Reviews.Author: HappyTravellers017
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel pleased us as a middle aged budget minded couple. The family who run this small hotel could not have been more helpful. Our room was clean and bright with a bar fridge and our own small bathroom. The hotel is an easy stroll to all the local tourist spots yet far enough away from all the hustle and bustle to be able to experience local life. The vaporetto is 2 minutes walk and there are restaurants next door.The hotel does not have all the whistles and bells of 5star hotels, including no lift, but, this is Venice and keeping this in mind we think very good value. We would recommend it to any of our family or friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrBred
Reviews.Content: We have stayed there for 3 nigths in Novembre. This hotel is well located. It is really close to railway station and public transport station. The hotel is quiet with family atmosphere. The room was clear. Staff was friendly. I can recommend to you this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend this hotel to anybody.”
Reviews.Author: HallettBristol
Reviews.Content: Agree with all the good points in previous reviews. Good in every respect, and wonderful to find something in Venice that's not a rip-off. Staff were very helpful and friendly. Very quick and easy to find on arrival, even in the dark (important benefit after a long journey). Some early morning noise from the busy canal nearby but otherwise a great find.

Reviews.Title: “Great Bargin, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: musicnick
Reviews.Content: This hostel was great! We told the staff the night before that we had to leave early in the morning, before breakfast would be served. The left us breakfast at the front desk so that we could have something to eat on our train ride to Florence! The staff also gave us great tips on local attractions, ways to get around (cheaper ways) and great food. The location of the hotel was great, within walking distance from the train station. I loved it here and would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rive306
Reviews.Content: I stayed on feb 22 to 24 feb' 09. They welcome me with my name, great location, clean and the staff was very frendly i no have any complain for this hotel. About 10 minutes from the bus station and 5 minutes from train station. Breakfast was very nice..have cappucino, ham, chesse, cereal, fruts and orange juices. Room was very clean in a very quiet....I have a great time in this hotel....i will stay again in this hotel....very nice....

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended hotel”
Reviews.Author: b0nnesvacances
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with this small hotel, we were there for 3 nights at beg of Feb. Spotless and welcoming and located in the best part of Venice to have your hotel. Close to the transport to the airport but within an easy walk of the main sights. Closer to the hotel, good restaurants within a short walking distance. We will certainly recommend to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel....”
Reviews.Author: Khopdee
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a weekend. Costed us only 43 Euros/day.So cant complain about price. The breakfast was good.The rooms were very clean and neat. Located near the 'Guglie' water stop.great starting point. All in all a very good experience and yes, the staff were very good and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good price, good clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cazp123
Reviews.Content: Really sweet little place, very close to the station and if you're flying home from Marco Polo you can get a water bus from outside the hotel straight to the airport. The staff were really nice and helpful too and as eveyone says they speak good English. Our double room was clean and comfortable and we'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Pipingshrike
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 4 who stayed in a quadruple room at the hotel. The location was really great, within walking distance of the railway station and close to the main route to San Marco. The real bonus is that the location is very quiet and in an interesting and more peaceful part of Venice. The room was very clean, possibly a little crowded with the extra bed, but this didn't bother us at all , because at least we were in a quad. room which can be difficult to find. The breakfasts were also generous and delicious, especially the hot chocolates made for the children. I think it represented good value for money in great location. I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The best place for this price in Venezia”
Reviews.Author: garpison
Reviews.Content: The best place to stay in Venezia for this price! A cool family hotel with great and simple room, payed 70â‚¬ per person. Close to the station, and in the cool Canareggio area, close to everything but not too touristic, that is for me the best compromise!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: RN4
Reviews.Content: We just stayed in the Hesperia Hotel in Venice. We chose this hotel from comments listed at the Trip Advisor site. Thanks so much for everyones recommendation for this hotel. We were here after finishing a cruise. We were able to walk to the hotel from the cruise ship (Not an easy walk with luggage but doable). Our friends paid 90â‚¬ to get to their hotel. We were able to check in early and take showers. The hosts were able to give directions and instructions on places to go. The next morning we had a very easy walk to the Allilugna (water bus) to get to the airport. Only over one bridge. The breakfast included the next morning was above our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: h2ofall2
Reviews.Content: 4 night stay in early May. It was our 2nd staying there after, first time 3 years ago. Would stay there again. Good view of the canal, staff extremely helpful with recommendations and they even have vaporetto tickets for sale. They recommended Osteria Giorgino for dinner and was probably one of the top meals throughout 17 days in italy. The rooms are the standard small room, but besides sleeping at night and my standard late afternoon nap, we don't spend alot of time in the room. All the staff exceedingly friendly and helpful. My bad habit of smoking had me going downstairs in the morning and talking with the fellow that works at night till 8 am and him telling me about growing up and living in Venice. He told me when we checked out that he was going to miss our early morning smokebreaks. I had to say that I will miss our talks also.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: crazy_maria
Reviews.Content: We did not stay at this hotel but in an apartment of theirs nearby. After contacting several hotels that were full and being referred to the Hotel Hesperia, we arrived to find the hotel fully booked. They offered to house us in a small apartment nearby for a price less than for a hotel room. Staff member Caterina (wonderful kind young woman) showed us to the apartment located several blocks away (which was actually closer to the Rialto Bridge and other attractions) and upon seeing it, we accepted. Caterina then took our payment and returned to our "flat" later that evening with our receipt and passports - she also brought us extra towels, garbage bags etc,,, - well and above expected service. Other staff were just as wonderful. When we checked with the hotel the next day to pay the remainder of our charges, the desk clerk helped us with vaporetto information and even called and re-confirmed our departing flight for us. Both woman spoke great English and were outstanding in their helpfulness and courtesy. We will definitely recommend this hotel to anyone going to Venice!

Reviews.Title: “good hotel & good loacation”
Reviews.Author: sorchadeas
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3nights last summer. We had the room on the terrace at the very top of the hotel which was really nice & private as you had the terrace to yourself most of the time. Hotel is in a nice area & about 15mins from st marks square. We had breakfast outside in the morning whch was lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent !”
Reviews.Author: Alanyeti
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a three night break at the Hesperia: it was all that it promised to be. The area of Canneregio is indeed close to the railway station, and to the Piazza de Roma, walkable even with luggage, but easier by vaporetto. It's relatively quiet, 100 metres off the main tourist drag, and inhabited by locals, giving it a living feel. The hotel whose entrance is just off the 'fundamento' just past the chinese restaurant, was welcoming, with its staff having, as promised, fluent english, french, german (as well as Italian !). It's small, clean, comfortable. We had two rooms: the first a 'superior' second floor room with a canal view, which was a characterful room with big wooden beams, a small lobby with chairs, and a clean modern shower room. At our request we transferred to the delightful room on the roof-top terrace (great for sitting and enjoying an al fresco cigarette as all rooms are non-smoking) . Again very clean, with refurbished, stylish shower room, and quite spacious enough. Breakfasts perfectly adequate (by continental standards): more coffee, croissants, etc. produced cheerfully on request. I accept that the absence of a lift may be a drawback for some, but otherwise a delightful place to stay. I'll definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: puddingthedog
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from a week in Venice, staying at this hotel. I thought the staff were great, very friendly and helpful and they spoke English. I also overheard them speaking French to other guests and they seemed to understand fine. The location is great, plenty of nice places to eat nearby, handy for the vaperetto and easy walking distance to the Rialto. Venice is much smaller than I expected.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: bistvan
Reviews.Content: i spent four nights in this hotel. well, if you are experienced in the venezian hotel prices you know that the price of this hotel is quite low, even if it would be an expensive one anywhere else in the world... so, the location could not be better. there is nothing else to say in this case. the staff was very helpful, the breakfast was ok. my room was a small but cosy one. typical venezian. but who wants to stay in a hotel room in venezia more than a few hours? there's a lot of other things to see there... :) overall, the hotel is absolutely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, low price”
Reviews.Author: freetogoConnecticut
Reviews.Content: We booked the Hesperia because of its proximity to the train terminal in Venice. We arrived from Vienna to connect with a cruise and had two very large suitcases. Moving suitcases in Venice is a major hassle if they are large and/or you are not as young as you used to be because you have to either take the bags on and off the vaporettos (bus boats) and drag them (some times up stairs and over bridges) to your hotel or take the VERY expensive water taxis (as in $100 for a relatively short ride). The Hesperia is only a few minutes walk from the station, and there are no canals to cross. The room was small, but clean and adequate for our short stay. The staff was very accommodating, and the hotel was quiet. There was a breakfast buffet, more of the "continental" variety, then the full-scale buffet offered in some other hotels. For the price, 75 euros, the hotel was a good buy in a very expensive city.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: milmol_7
Reviews.Content: With such a huge array of hotels in Venice and an equally huge range of quality reviews for almost all, we came across the Hesperia which seemed to have mostly all positive reviews. We were not disappointed at all. Our room was small (but this is always going to be the case in Venice by nature of most of the buildings) but nice and clean and the bed was comfortable. The bathroom also small, but we didnt want a dance in the room or the bathroom, just clean and tidy, which is exactly what we got. The breakfast was a basic but fresh continental breakfast (bread, jams, fruit and cheeses) , which set us up for the day each day. We ate outside each morning. The lady on reception spoke excellent English, very friendly and gave us recommendations for restaurants etc and any other help we asked. We arrived by train and the hotel was a 5 minute walk. The vaporetto stop is just outside the hotel but the main canal stop is only around the corner too. In summary, if like us you have a few nights in Venice, your head is spinning with where to stay and you need somewhere clean, reasonably priced, welcoming, convenient and comfortable I don't think you will go far wrong with the Hesperia.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, small and smart hotel”
Reviews.Author: miabonds
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here ages ago!!! But I'vejust loved it! Clean, comfortable, great location and very helpful staff - most of them speak English well.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem in Venice”
Reviews.Author: dbifulco
Reviews.Content: This is the 5th time we've stayed at Hesperia and we always love returning. The hotel is only a short walk from the train station, yet in a quiet area. TIt is also an easy stroll to the Rialto bridge and the other key sights of Venice. The hotel was renovated a few years ago and the rooms are spacious, the beds firm, and the bathrooms modern. We always request a room racing the Canale Cannerrigio - it's a bit noisier during the day, but what fun to watch the delivery boats coming and going. Best of all, however, are the sisters who run Hesperia, Carolina and Martina! They always greet guests warmly and are happy to make recommendation on dining, shopping, transportation and sights. We look forward to our next visit to the Hotel Hesperia!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - Would definitely recommend”
Reviews.Author: our-honeymoon2007
Reviews.Content: Fantastic Hotel!! I would rate this 5 stars!! Very clean. Rooms are small but that's what you expect all over Venice. The staff were very helpful and had excellent English. We were given the room on the Terrace which has a canal view only from the front door (the terrace area) but it was a great room all on our own. Not having to worry about the people in the room next door. The feature of this room is the bathroom. It was definitely 5 star - brand new - you could just tell it was extremely clean and this was really important. I would recommend this hotel to all types of travellers!! We really enjoyed our stay and will be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: TheClock
Reviews.Content: Hotel is great. Stayed for 2 nights in August. Situated in a quite street but walking distance from Venice St. Lucia train station. When u get out of the station don't cross the grand canal from the bridge instead take the street on the left of the Station. Its a narrow street and keep walking where ever the street takes u (its venice so not really possible to get lost) when u reach another canal (cannageo) and a bride don't cross the bridge instead turn left walking parallel to the canal. Just after crossing a chinese restaurant, there is a street and the hotel is the right in front of u on the right. The whole walk takes max 10 minutes if u have luggage. There is also a small general store next to the hotel run by an old lady. Good to get water etc at reasonable prices but it closes soon after 6 p.m. Chinese restuarant mentioned earlier is good, do try it. Room was spacious, very comfortable with nice bathroom of good size. It seemed that the bathroom had been redone recently so it was great. Our room had a split air conditioner which worked just fine. We were given a choice between a room with a great view of the canal but its bathroom was down the hall (although exclusive) and a room with no view but attached bathroom. There's no lift which is expected from hotels in venice. There is water bus station right in front of the hotel (Guglie). So its great for people who don't want to walk too much as well. Breakfast was standard europian breakfast...bread, cheese, jams, butter, juice etc. Staff was very friendly and co-operative. I would recommend this hotel to all.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Little Hotel by the Cannaregio Canal”
Reviews.Author: si_pooh
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel at a great location. 5 min walk from the Santa Lucia train station and very close to the water bus station. We stayed in a room in the 2nd floor overlooking the Cannaregio canal. The room was small but clean and air conditioned. Breakfast was excellent. Staff was very helpful. Would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Hesperia”
Reviews.Author: Fletch_in_Wales
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading other good reviews and we were definitely not disappointed. The hotel was easy to find (even at night and in the rain) and was in a lovely, quiet location on the Cannaregio canal. (Tip - from M. Polo airport we recommend taking an ATVO blue bus for â‚¬3 per person to P. Roma then getting the vaporetto to the 'Guglie' stop which is just opposite the hotel. It's an easy and cheap way to get to the hotel). The hotel itself was very clean, warm and cosy. All the staff were very friendly and were always on hand to help in any way. Our room was a good-sized double with a nice, clean bathroom - the rooms were cleaned every day. The nearest Vaporetto stop was just across the bridge (3 mins walk), the bus and train station were also easily accessible although we found the best mode of transport was walking. We stayed for 5 nights in the hotel and had a really enjoyable stay. For a 2* hotel in Venice we thought it was very good value-for-money and would definitely recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Even Better Than Expected!”
Reviews.Author: Eurekaandvoila
Reviews.Content: we selected two nights at the Hesperia (Dec. 17-19, 2006) after spending much time online reading personal reviews of hotel stays in Venice. Everything was enjoyable: very clean rooms, hotel ambience, an excellent selection of breakfast food, a cheerful staff, and location by the canal. Also it was nice to have quiet. If I had to offer any constructive criticism, it might be that we did, perhaps a couple of times, get a whiff of cigarette smoke. But most of the time that was not an issue at all. The price was even exceptional - under the norm. Large, private shower, not one of those you can hardly turn around in. Furnishings attractive and pleasant. We were on the second floor and had three comfortable beds. Colorful stairway. Staff speaks English well. TV, hair dryer, small refrigerator. Those European towel-warmers always impress me, I never see them here in the States. Half a block down the canal was a nice restaurant where we had dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: RDCononver
Reviews.Content: I had a nice stay at the Hotel Hesperia, I got the tip floor room, it was a bit unique which added to the experience. Negitives were that the AC was not that good (but it did the trick), and the shower is a bit small. The staff and the owners were very nice and helpful, breakfast was simple (yogert, fruit, fresh breads and cerials) but good, good for an Itialinan 1 star. The location was fantastic (just a 7 min walk to the train station and 15 min to the bus/taxi termal. I would stay there again.
